27OkUEwR1I5IXvHlWe8hNg.text: Horrible interior, though you'd expect that given that it's a Wetherspoons. The drinks selection, however, is fairly large and good value. I'd still much rather pay a little more to drink somewhere that has atmosphere.

Q8hnvuo2T9ZYGs7WHjU5jQ.text: Not much point going these days now they've not got Sky TV. I guess it's ok for cheap reliable food though.

2dJB_hH1MebzBmieL0fzIQ.text: It is not the type of place you would normally find me on a Saturday night but there I was last night enjoying a couple of pints. It is very big generic wetherspoon type establishment on the Charing X road. It is not easily missed and the name is clearly signposted. There was a door-man in attendance and my bag was checked and I was not allowed to take my bottle of water in. The person I was with was made to take his hat off as well. Walking in, I could see that it was fairly busy and quite buzzy. There is a bar to the left of the floor and further to the back there is a Lloyds bar section with seating for dining but you could also sit anywhere else and order food from the bar I think. There are two large screens and both were playing standard pop music videos. There is also an upper floor with more seatings and the toilets are also upstairs. Upon walking to the bar I could see leffe in the fridge and wherever there is leffe there is bound to be fruli! There were a wide selection of beer on tap and lots of other choices of drinks including cocktails. The prices very very cheap for that part of town (a pint of fruli and one of Kronneburg came to £6.50). All in all not a bad place to spend an hour or so and not as soulless as one would imagine.

EBrLSKLZAY6-O2KgOy0B1g.text: Popped in for a bite to eat one weekday evening, standard Wetherspoons fayre, I opted for the 'Gormet Burger' with a free pint thrown in for just under £8.Well that's a bargain in anyone's book but even more so in the heart of the Big Smoke where a pint is over £4 on it's own.But the proof of the pudding (or Burger) is in the eating.Well I've previously had this meal In Bournemouth, and very nice it was too, and this was just as good.Nicely cooked meaty slice of Cow, topped with Bacon,Stilton and Shropshire Blue & spring onion sauce, two dips (Relish, Mayo) plus some nice chunky chips and 'real' Onion Rings to accompany it.The only negative was the bun was a bit limp and pretty much fell apart when picked up, it could have done with toasting, but other than that a tasty meal at a bargain price.

ZnW0ggEhAmw5TL0qaD6Uow.text: It's a giant Spoons. It is always loud and sticky and a bit meh, but when not terribly busy, it can be a decent spot to sit down and have a nibble and a drink.  All the times I've ever been here have been through the organizing of someone other than myself!The last time we were in (this past Friday), we dealt with the rudest staff member. The bell rang for last call and suddenly 3 men in fluorescent vests were there to usher us out of the back half of the pub. Not kindly, either. "This area is now closed. You need to leave."  No 5 minute warning. No politeness at all. So we begin to gather up our coats and scarves and bags and the one guy gets in our face "You need to LEAVE NOW! I already told you!"  - to which I not-so-nicely replied to him to "calm the f* down - we're just getting our things." He was taken aback at my equal response to his nastiness and a few in our party all said that we were just getting our coats on, etc. He then said that we had 15 minutes til the pub closed, but that this area was closed right now and he didn't mean to imply that we had to actually leave the premises.  Sure, dude. You were all sunshine and roses...ugh.I fully understand the need to have people clearing out sections of an establishment toward the end of the night. But harassing jerks do not need to be in the mix of employees doing that job. Not impressed.

Yt_vKRSQcxl4gTQST2U2cA.text: I love Wetherspoon's pubs but this is honestly one of the worst I have ever visited. At night this place is absolutely rammed with youngsters getting pissed on cheap hooch. Also older people getting slammed on the cheap stuff. They show big sporting events here, which REALLY draws the riff raff out of the woodwork. In fact, JDW claim on their website to have the BIGGEST screen in the West End. They do have some cask stuff but really you would probably be better off heading elsewhere to enjoy a pint. Also, they are Cask Marque Accredited here!

TMrToblmiX4i-Wc0TYRhhQ.text: i find myself coming here from time to time when i'm in soho and want to enjoy a seat with my drink (not always easy to find in this area!). in principle, i'm not a huge fan of wetherspoons, so i do tend to avoid them. i have to say though - this place is cavernous so you're always able to find a seat. they tend to keep it quite clean, there are lots of servers/bars so you are never waiting too long, and the prices/selection is reasonable. even the toilets are nice and clean - a plus point which is so often forgotten about, even in decent places.i was disappointed that they had a well priced bottle of gavi di gavi on their wine menu, but didn't actually stock it. BOO. we settled for a bottle of new zealand sauvignon blanc and it was really great, and well priced at £16 a bottle. probably the best deal in the area.i know i'll return here. it has location, seats, and good prices. i'm sold (& this particular wetherspoons even plays music, which is nice).

wkiQJVPHL0PILQgFvy-lww.text: Its a large Weatherspoons enough said !!!! But hay its got a good selection of ales and if your a camra member a good place to use a beer voucher or 2 before moving on.This place use to be the Marquee Club great music venue but rather sticky floor, how times change.

Ern3HBBhK40pUilS68DzLA.text: Great for a student budgetEasy location in the central soho area A wide range full bar available DRINKS specials are AwesomeThey also serve food which is good just average but again the prices average £5-9 So again can have cheap eats and drinks This location is a huge bar/seating area with enough room to dance once the night sesh begins. It's a friendly environment.

jjea5tucR4YhNXoVUUDTrQ.text: Huge Wetherspoons in Camden Town on outskirts of Soho. Nice and clean with lots of seating and friendly staff. Typical WS fayre at slightly under typical London prices.

GVpQYkxhUGP-oPYk0ilOww.text: It is another JD Wetherspoons, well actually a Lloyds No.1 that I cannot fault. The location is as good as it gets for a pub with so much people traffic in this area.The bar itself is huge and stocks the impressive Wetherspoons menu you see throughout all their bars. It is cheap, hearty fare whose quality rarely fluctuates. Since changing to a Lloyds No.1, the introduction of music and one of London's biggest screens for sport has transformed this bar.The place comes alive when sport is on and there is enough standing room and dining tables to keep everyone happy.My favourite time is mid afternoon where there is a quieter vibe and I can relax away from the bustle of Central London.

photos.caption: Photo of The Montagu Pyke - London, United Kingdom

rJ4PzLDcjuiaqWbpS4iuYw.text: As one would expect from a Wetherspoon's pub The Montagu Pyke is large, impersonal and cheap. Especially considering it's Central London location this pub is huge. The Soho entrance leads on to  a smaller side bar and seating area, whilst the Charing Cross entrance leads directly into the large main seating area and bar. The decor isn't very exciting, but they have taken some care with it and consequently the place feels rather smart and modern.It is the sort of place I seem to go when meeting out-of-towners, though last weekend I went with an all London crowd. The drinks are cheap and there is a large and at least servicable selection (in summer the pear Koppaberg cider is a a reason to go). The corwd is fairly mixed during the day. At night it is largely revellers drinking before going to one of the Central London clubs. As the main attraction is the prices there is nothing that particularly defines the crowd apart from, perhaps, a lack of means. The clientele coupled with the decor gives the place a lack of atmosphere.It is not a bad place just incredibly average.

photos.caption: Photo of The Montagu Pyke - London, United Kingdom

SK7LsUqFHJhvdDcGEZG9hQ.text: One of my favourite pubs in London, not only is it cheap because it's a Whetherspoons - yes i know, but stay with me here - but it's cool, unpretentious vibe attracts a lot of the local crowd. Converted from a theatre, it is HUGE but I've always been hard pushed to find a table. Late license and live music or DJ set means you don't really have to leave but is good for a starting point or quick dinner. Menu is your standard pub grub and drinks from are home and away. Sometimes you get deals on cocktails and there recently was a £1 a pint offer SCORE!

PH6GmmRg-b3FG-xfUhhcPQ.text: A big sports bar in Soho. You can get a simple burger with fries and a drink for £7.50. You need to order them at the bar though. We had lunch there on Sunday and it was almost empty and the lights went out for most of our lunch. I guess it must be livelier at night or when matches are on, otherwise find somewhere else to grab a cheap bite.

YG4yanZFGh2eVDq4lT25-w.text: Whether you like weatherspoons or not, the Montague Pyke certainly offers something different from most other London pubs. Its vast size alone is something worth noting, because with live music and a late license you'd could easily find yourself having fun and dancing without having to pay stupid amounts of money to get in.With a typical pub selection of drinks, and decent bar staff the montague pyke, ultimately only a pub, offers a more enjoyable experience than most other pubs, especially if you are in a group of friends, it is a great place to start the night off and most people do before going onto "Club 49" just opposite. However for those too young to get into selected clubs it's a great place to be on the weekend until you reach legal age.Th major players in here are the men in suits, and also the fair few youngsters that come in from China town after playing arcade games on the weekdend.This fancy pub which has two entrances on either end, one opening on Greek st and the other on Charringcross rd, is a great place and a lot of fun. I'm definately a fan.

P1gotRjgXBzB0PslsOpfsQ.text: The Montague Pyke is a huge Weatherspoons located in the middle of town.  It has ample seating, big screens, nice toilets, and cheap drinks so it is a good place to head there if that is what you are looking for.  The clientele is very varied from random tourists, young people out of some drinks before a night out, football fiends, to chavs.  It closes on time and the bouncers can be a bit harsh, so behave!  But like all Weatherspoons, it is soulless.  It looks OK and can provide some well needed rest but nothing else.  It is however, a very good place to stop by if you are walking around town and in need of a toilet.  I have already popped in a couple of times for that sole purpose and you won't get any dirty looks or feelings of guilt that you would get in a smaller and nicer place.

ql5JHL3CU-dPrMzXN8_grQ.text: I'm actually sat in here at the moment using their free Wi-Fi to write an article and I thought I may as well add my review too. It's a typical Wetherspoons to be honest - you know what you're going to get. It's huge and does lack a bit of atmosphere to be honest. Two bars in the one pub does means you can get served quicker though. The service was really helpful, Old Rosie was on tap, it's cheap and cheerful, it has wifi when I desperately needed it, and they claim to have the biggest screen to watch sport in the West End. As a Wetherspoons/Lloyd's No.1 it also means it has a good range of real ale and has even cheaper prices for wine until 8 June 2008. The food was good too, just what I need at this precise moment. It also serves as a pretty handy shortcut between Greek Street and Charing Cross Street.

tgBmN4_BblsbcJ1IxAjNTw.text: The montague pyke on tottenham court road is a lloyds bar (the same chain as weatherspoons) and a very good place to start off for a night out in the centre. It is within a 5 min walking distance of leicester sq! At one time, 5 years ago to be precise, it was £1.99 for a double vodka and red bull, and thanks to Weatherspoons, I was able to save money at university. The more I drank, the more I saved if that makes sense!!!For example, to this day, weatherspoons offers a number of deals:The Monday club offers a number of drinks on special promotion, Tue night is steak night (around £5-6 with a drink included) and my personal favorite is CURRY NIGHT on Thu (£5.30 max per person). These prices are very reasonable and although it is not gourmet cuisine, it is cheap and cheerful and I do enjoy the opportunity to catch up with my buddies!

gKPz5ncxBCVyga5R1_F5Qw.text: This is a typical Wetherspoons boozer - it looks like pretty much any other one you are likely to visit. I agree with other posters, it has no atmosphere, mainly due to it's cavernous size. However, this makes it very attractive to students, so the place is rammed with youngster searching for cheap as chips drinks and somebody to take home for the night after consuming all those drinks! On the other hand, it does have a really wide range of lovely real ales at fantastically cheap prices so if you are looking for a cheap drink at lunchtime with an equally cheap meal then this is the place to go.

K_yTCv2X90JwebJa1uSO9A.text: Just went here last night with a friend, and would have to say that it was not a good experience at all!!!  First off, we wanted to order their "Christmas Special" that was advertised with flyers at every table, that apparently has been going on for a little less than a month now, and as we ordered it we were told that their Special has been a little late now and would not have it until Sunday.  After that we should have known to to just get our things and leave, but we decided to stay.  I then looked over the menu again and decided to order Buffalo wings as a starter and half a roasted chicken with mashed potatoes as my meal, only after waiting about 20 minutes to actually get my order in.  Then we finally get the wings, but no plates came with it so we asked the waitress to please bring TWO plates since we were sharing the wings, only to wait for about 8 minutes and she returns with only one plate.  Then we finally get our food which was only OK since my chicken was a bit too dry for my liking and I was not all that impressed with the gravy on the side either.  However, I did have a very decent amount left over, so I decided to go get a take away box, only to find out that they "don't do take away."  Overall, I did not enjoy my visit here this time around, and the only reason I would come back would be to have a drink since they do have a good drink selection and because of its location, but other than that I wouldn't return.

2hkYjjFasGxHKubqFIVJEQ.text: The Montague Pyke is a Wetherspoons pub which means it is good for reasonable drinks and food. They also offer a good cup of coffee for just over £1 which comes with the tiniest biscuit!This is an excellent place to come on a saturday or friday night when they have the music up and it's still free to get in, they also sell a few cocktails for under £10 a pitcher or about £3 a glass.However, I was unimpressed when I went there to eat as the pasta dish was tiny and was almost £8 and the food took ages even though it was clearly microwaved like most pubs! The other downside is the ladies toilets are up a lot of stairs then more stairs when you get in the toilet area, not a good idea when mixed with alcohol!

vGetKIw3EXiKNBEjG5KVBw.text: Look,its a wetherspoons expect the usual mixed crowd of tourists, students,tight feckers an old people. Dosent make it a bad pub. Clean ,average service , loads or room plus the usual quiz machines an fruitys.cheap an cheerful for the west end . Why be ripped off in the pitcher an piano?. Worth a visit for a quick cheap jar or seven then go somewhere nice after!

cOKqgmFIg4bcOM9GaMl-3g.text: This is a cavernous Wetherspoons pub (originally a cinema). It has 2 entrances, the main one in Charing Cross Road, and a rather understated one in Greek StreetThere are 2 bars, the main one close to the main entrance has a good range of beers and (not so common in this area) ciders, while the 2nd bar has a slightly smaller selection of the same range. Decor is fairly cinema themed, especially in the centralw auditorium area, with tv's dotted around and at least 1 big screen / projector setup. Usually they are showing a news channel, but I have seen them showing football sometimes. Food is std Wetherspoons fare, with the usual themed 'club' nights, and is pretty good (Wetherspoons food does vary dramatically between pubs) and inexpensive. Overall I'd rate it as a good pub to meet up in as its big with plenty of tables. If you prefer somewhere for a quiet chat then maybe not as the background chatter can be quite loud as it echoes around, but it is bearable.

swMGzQdRtLJb22QLhCzvUw.text: Its got what every other Weatherspoons has - cheap alcohol - what more do you want?Its clean and very big - its always busy but you are always bound to find some seats! Its a chilled out relaxing place for a pint after work, its also conveniently located near Tottenham Court Road and Leicester Square tube stations.

497BeFcVIClfBiEihRtSDQ.text: Located in a somewhat touristy part of London, means that you don't have to reply too much on repeat trade. That may be the reason why this place is still open, that and it's no doubt propped up by the mighty 'spoons empire.It's easy to improve their rating. Clean your bloody pipes & pumps! There were pints left all around this place. Were they all due to dirty pipes? I don't know but I'd wager that a majority of the left pints were due to this. Pure laziness that ruins a pint. Nothing like paying London prices to get a skunky/stale beer.Go to one of the independent pubs & support people that care about the beer they serve.

is5Uv2V851xrtxti9t1B4g.text: Don't bother. I asked for an egg, beans and chips. Quite simple. They came out as three separate items. I had to ask for a large plate to put them together myself. The plate took three minutes to arrive. I had to ask for cutlery, and that took another minute to arrive. I spoke to the duty manager whose attitude stank. "You got what you asked for," he said, clearly uninterested. And to top it off the egg was cold. Usually you know what you're getting at Wetherspoons, but this was an anomaly. Don't bother.

photos.caption: Photo of The Montagu Pyke - London, United Kingdom. Montagu Pyke. Absolute shite.

BkI3rDoohGnpuvR7T7tsuw.text: What can I say, it's a weather spoons. There isn't much I can say that hasn't already been said on previous reviews about this place. It's probably the cheapest place in the west end and that's the only appeal.

photos.caption: Photo of The Montagu Pyke - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Montagu Pyke - London, United Kingdom

FIGZ2zwV4s8PhgVTGz1SWQ.text: Came here with a local friend while visiting London. I was famished and this was literally the first place we walked by with food, so we went in. The place was lively and looked popular with both locals and tourist. There is no hostess, you just grab any available seat and the go to the bar to order both drinks and food. We ordered the chicken burger, aka a chicken sandwich.... don't order the chicken sandwich, it was tasteless and something you eat when your drunk and don't care about taste. Needles to say, I wasn't drunk. The drinks are ok, but I had to order a double gin and tonic to get it to the strength I'm used to in the states. My friend ordered a pint of beer, which was what most were drinking.All in all it was just OK. Didn't hate it, didn't love it.

7XSKN3u_6e0feoF3FcYScw.text: I have been to this pub in two occasions.First of them was ok, Central London Wetherspoons, so reasonable prices for the reasonable food and drinks. Very busy, but to be expected due to the location.Second time here, horrible. Super busy again, expected due to Friday rainy afternoon, even though the place is quite big and it was not that late. Took ages to order and obviously no place to sit. It is fine, let's have one drink and leave. The staff at the bar was rude and impolite. And that is a big 'NO NO' for me. We moved to a side, but we were so upset that left without even finishing our drinks.

KzvhumUgQzGcPL7ihtuemQ.text: Basically, you get what you pay for with this place. Yes, the food is cheaper than most other pubs in the area, but it's also not very good. It's decent and edible and fine for the price, but don't expect great food.This place is quite large, so you'll likely always find a seat somewhere. There's also a little gallery at the top overlooking the pub, which is quite nice. Overall I did enjoy the time here, mostly because of the company I was with, and I'd definitely come back, but not for the food...

fzyx5t1QjTxqXrMHU8XeYQ.text: This is a great big barn of a Wetherspoons on the site of the legendary Marquee club and there are nods to its musical heritage on the walls. It has an enormous drop-down screen to show football matches and one bar given over to Craft Beers. The main bar serves the usual fare for a pub. It's well located for a pre or post theatre drink or a cheap bite to eat but is far from cosy.

shJKrSKEFPEjsbwCs3kdEg.text: Offering the best range of drinks I have ever seen in London, this pub certainly has something for everyone. Wide screen tvs are well placed throughout, the bar is of a good length and so well serviced that you don't normally have to queue much. Its main downfall is that seating is often hard come by and the atmosphere is not accentuated by music which when used well can make a venue yet more enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of The Montagu Pyke - London, United Kingdom. Cider festival set of three ciders

rVqXO_StBAzHB9eCBMOmzQ.text: I don't suggest staying away from any place and I won't here but I would suggest you eat before you get here and start drinking. The beer is plentiful and cold. If you think if this place as a place to drink and not a place to eat you will be well served. Sorry I couldn't recommend anything to eat.

KNOfVlZntzmyhiuIIvngpA.text: Not the most cozy place, but deasent food and a good selection of Ales on tap. We were there on a thursday and that means Curry. :-) We ordered one Rogan Josh and one lasagne. Have to say that the curry was far better than the lasagne. The selection of local ales is this chains strong point. It is worth the visit, but don't expect to much of the kitchen.

photos.caption: Photo of The Montagu Pyke - London, United Kingdom. Curry club thursday. :-) A very nice Rogan Josh with a extra helping of poppadums and dip.

yQ5cv_EPJbahiT677WuunA.text: My husband and I have been going to this pub for years. We like it here. It's absolutely massive inside and across two floors. Their decor is right up our street, random electric guitars and other cool stuff. They even have these little booths along the side making it look so attractive. We've never dined here but the impression of a Wetherspoons-like food menu is present.

photos.caption: Photo of The Montagu Pyke - London, United Kingdom
Photo of The Montagu Pyke - London, United Kingdom

AnAhlbyv7C7fU_vGtPrqCw.text: This place is great if you love a pub that has lost everything that makes it a pub. It was tolerable for my first few visits, but after tonight, I will specifically warn against visitors to London from now on.    So there I was, right, trying to have dinner with my friends. All meals but one came out. That meal never arrived. When asked, the bar staff insisted the meal was served. The "manager" went as far as to say he checked the surveillance camera to prove it was served (though he would not show us said evidence). He proceeded to call us liars in a loud enough voice, one might say he was yelling at us...   I say "manager" because he told us his manager refused to refund us. When we asked about his being the manager,  he stumbled... "er, I mean, I won't take it off the tab..."   Awful.  Never again.

ITJu1i5kAFnKRYwvsUFmbw.text: Nice selection of beer ales and cider, 2 bars so don't have to wait too long, sells sam adams which is a bonus, food was good, cheap and cheerful for central London with a good atmosphere.

oOq7I6EDc4a00Kjhq2_CDQ.text: Good fish and chips. The fish was breaded lightly -- just enough. The chips were tasty, and not too greasy. The restaurant is in a renovated cinema, so the décor feels more like a generic restaurant or sports bar than a pub. If you're looking for an "authentic" pub experience, look elsewhere. If you're looking for good and reasonably priced pub food near Leicester Square and Tottenham Court, this is a good place.

c_I9HO2QBzFfw14i6t3JEw.text: Consistently good service (been popping in for years) and always somewhere to sit despite how ridiculous central it is. My only jibe is how much of a schlep it is to get to the ladies' toilets. The upside of that is that they're always pretty clean, however!

V-RX-i_YKmpkjNBq5JVw6g.text: Yes it's a Wetherspoons, get over it. Nothing super special, but it's just fine and dandy!This place is huge and yet, is always busy (and oddly a good place to meet with friends). It's probably rammed for the two best things about it: cheap drinks and giant tv screens to watch the sports. They have lots of vegan beers available- and on tap as well. I haven't had any of the food, but it's inexpensive as well and has the calories listed on the menu.Oh, and ladies, either go to the toilet when you get there or don't "break the seal" because the toilets seem to be located in the next postcode up 100 stairs. It can be a bit tricky after having a few drinks!

sCVPrCpBUlVZd-B37umcCQ.text: This place was a very solid place to meet up with friends. If you want to grab drinks and chill out with good folks, this is the place to be.There are plenty of signs reminding you to watch your bag for thieves, which is actually fairly helpful (and a bit sad eh?) for me who is a tourist who isn't as aware or used to dealing with rampant theft. It's nicely placed in central London and still avoids the anxiety-inducing prices that the area is known for. Also there's a ton of room, so you're almost always guaranteed to find a place to sit. The service is decently friendly and the food also succeeds at hitting the spot. Probably cus you'll already be a bit buzzed anyways.I don't really get the hate on Wetherspoons. From my experience it's quite sufficient in delivering the mediocrity but decent prices it promises. The staff was friendly enough and the food was deep fried to expectations.  If you need a cheap drink, this is the place to be!

TzX8SiITe7KN9E4PEP_7NA.text: I'm really disappointed in Montague's because it was literally just last week that I gave this place a good four star rating. A friend and I came here on a busy night and the place was packed. We scored a table and began to order their "Christmas Special" dinner that was advertised on their table menus. The bartender told us that they have "delayed" the deal and were not offering the deal until next week. The deal states it would be available from mid November to mid December....this is a big problem because if they aren't offering the deal, they need to most definitely remove those mini table menus immediately and even offer some type of voucher as compensation for the inconvenience and FALSE ADVERTISEMENT. I was very distraught about this situation because they didn't seem to be at all concerned that they were still displaying the deal even if it was entirely ineffective for order.The bar-staff was busy but not THAT busy to act like total pricks. They were emotionless and careless. They didn't give half a shit for their customers...I stood there for 25 minutes trying to place my order and they were helping people out of order. The woman that helped me almost refused to substitute my side salad for mashed potatoes and she walked nearly across the entire restaurant to ask if it were okay. Ridiculous. Foul service and shameful.Also, it was very embarrassing that the waiter asked my friend for her receipt as he placed the dish under her nose. Very unprofessional and it was his job to make sure that he served the right table before presenting the dish in front of her.P.S bring your tupperware... If you can't finish half your plate like I couldn't ...they don't offer take away boxes. Money down the drain.

U501hanrC7i4Hqi1S0Y7ZA.text: This is a Wetherspoons pub located in Central London so the prices are great value compared to a lot of other pubs in the area. I prefer this branch to the one in Leicester Square which is not a spacious and can get a bit more rowdy. I like the fact that there is a balcony on the first floor overlooking the pub and it's a bit quieter up there.  It can get quite busy in here particularly if there is a sporting event on as they tend to show them on their projection screen.
